DataElement.preferredDefinition: The auditory faculty, the perception of sound by the ear._A clinically validated, US national hearing screening application (app) designed for accurate detection of hearing impairment. The screening analyzes the person's ability to perceive speech-in-noise. Based on the person's response, the app automatically generates a hearing score that indicates whether there may be a possible hearing loss._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The auditory faculty, the perception of sound by the ear._A clinically validated, US national hearing screening application (app) designed for accurate detection of hearing impairment. The screening analyzes the person's ability to perceive speech-in-noise. Based on the person's response, the app automatically generates a hearing score that indicates whether there may be a possible hearing loss.

Property.preferredDefinition: A clinically validated, US national hearing screening application (app) designed for accurate detection of hearing impairment. The screening analyzes the person's ability to perceive speech-in-noise. Based on the person's response, the app automatically generates a hearing score that indicates whether there may be a possible hearing loss.

Concepts.definition: A clinically validated, US national hearing screening application (app) designed for accurate detection of hearing impairment. The screening analyzes the person's ability to perceive speech-in-noise. Based on the person's response, the app automatically generates a hearing score that indicates whether there may be a possible hearing loss.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Changed from caBIG to PhenX for PANH by script 2015-12-21

ReferenceDocuments.name: hearScreen USA is a clinicall
ReferenceDocuments.description: hearScreen USA is a clinically validated, U.S. national hearing screening application (app). The app provides accurate detection of hearing impairment. The user is presented with a 23-step hearing screening test, the Digits in Noise Test (DIN).
